interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Optic Shop Pro-Moisture Chamber With Elastic Head Band - Size Small
Review Date: 2016/10/12
Store: Optic Shop
Product Description: ['Small PRO-MOISTURE CHAMBER WITH ELASTIC HEAD BAND - White Foam. One Elastic Chamber. Ideal for dry-eye conditions. Clear vinyl shield with soft sponge edging that gently hugs facial contours. Product dimensions: 40mm vertical, 60mm Horizontal. Combat miserable dry eye conditions with the Pro-Moisture Chamber with Elastic Head Band from Optic Shop. Clear vinyl shielding offers ideal eye protection. Inner lining of soft sponge material hugs the contours of the face and provides hours of comfortable wear. Comes with comfortable elastic head band, and fits both the left and right eyes. Size Small and package quantity of 1.']
Average Rating: 3.6
Product Details: {'Color': 'White', 'Age Range (Description)': 'Adult', 'Material': 'Plastic', 'Fabric Type': 'Foam', 'Number of Items': '1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '0.2 x 2.36 x 1.57 inches; 0.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': '144SB', 'Date First Available': 'May 20, 2015', 'Manufacturer': 'Optic Shop'}
Review Text: I bought this when I had a bout of bells palsy and I wish I wouldn't have wasted the money. I didn't really use it even though it was a great idea it was just uncomfortable and kept fogging up. The foam around it is rough and hurt the soft skin around my eye. The strap I found to be fine once I tied it off to fit me. I still have it and if I ever have another bout of BP I might glue or somehow put some soft fabric around it. Won't fix the fogging up but it might make it feel a little more comfortable. Don't have anything to lose. I wouldn't wear it like it is.
Review Title: Great idea....
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Health Focus:** The user has an interest in products that address specific health conditions, particularly dry-eye issues. 
- **Comfort Preference:** Strong emphasis on comfort; expressed discomfort regarding the product's materials and fit. 
- **Critical Evaluation:** Tends to critically evaluate product effectiveness based on personal experience, showing a pragmatic approach to purchases.
- **Functional Utility Over Aesthetics:** Values functionality in products but is open to modifications for enhanced comfort, indicating a hands-on attitude toward improving user experience.
- **Past Negative Experience:** Previous negative encounter with a health-related product leads to skepticism about equivalent future purchases.
- **Adaptability:** Willing to customize products (e.g., potentially putting soft fabric on the item) to improve comfort, showcasing a creative problem-solving mindset.

Overall, the user appears to prioritize health and comfort in product selection, demonstrating a critical and adaptive approach to addressing personal needs.
